name: Golden Delicious
qualities: Medium-to-large pale yellow or yellow-green apple that is mild and sweet
description: Grown in most regions across the country, Golden Delicious is the second-most grown after Red Delicious, to which it is not at all related.

name: Gala
qualities: Thin, red-orange skin — actually red striping over gold — encases aromatic, semisweet, yellowish white flesh
description: One of the most widely-grown apple varieties, with a sweet pleasant flavor, and good keeping qualities.

name: Fuji
qualities: Excellent for eating raw, adding to salads, and making into applesauce
description: Developed in Japan, but an all-American cross of Red Delicious and Ralls Janet. A very attractive modern apple, crisp, sweet-flavored, and keeps well.

name: Pink Lady
qualities: Ellipsoid shape, distinctive blush mixed with a green background, tart taste
description: One of the best-known modern apples, Pink Lady is actually a trademark and the variety is more correctly known as Cripps Pink.

name: Honeycrisp
qualities: Its sweetness, firmness, and tartness make it an ideal apple for eating raw
description: Sometimes marketed as Honey Crisp, this is a crisp, and predominantly sweet, modern variety from the USA. It was developed by the University of Minnesota specifically for growers in cold climates, and is one of the most cold-hardy of apple varieties.
